2015.title: 2015 Report: Impact of EVs on Urban Traffic
2015.content: In 2015, the adoption of electric vehicles (EVs) in major cities began to pick up pace. Cities like New York and Los Angeles saw a 5% increase in EV registrations. Traffic congestion, however, remained largely unchanged due to the low number of EVs compared to traditional vehicles.

2016.title: 2016 Report: EV Adoption and Traffic Patterns
2016.content: The year 2016 witnessed a 10% increase in EV adoption across urban areas. This led to a slight improvement in air quality in cities like San Francisco, but traffic congestion remained a challenge due to the slow rollout of EV-specific infrastructure.

2017.title: 2017 Report: Infrastructure Developments for EVs
2017.content: With the growth of EV adoption, 2017 saw significant investments in charging infrastructure. Cities like Seattle reported a 15% reduction in traffic congestion during peak hours as EV usage increased.
